<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>
<!DOCTYPE DOCSENT SYSTEM './docsent.dtd'>
<DOCSENT DID='25'>
  <BODY>
    <HEADLINE>
      <S SNO='1' PAR='1' RSNT='1'>FOXNews.com</S>
    </HEADLINE>
    <TEXT>
      <S SNO='2' PAR='2' RSNT='1'>MILAN, Italy   A small plane crashed into the tallest building in downtown Milan Thursday evening, causing smoke to pour out of the top floors of the skyscraper.</S>
      <S SNO='3' PAR='3' RSNT='1'>Three people were reported to have been killed, and rescue workers said dozens of people had been taken to a nearby hospital.</S>
      <S SNO='4' PAR='4' RSNT='1'>Officials said the crash appeared to have been an accident and that only the pilot was aboard.</S>
      <S SNO='5' PAR='5' RSNT='1'>The weather was clear at the time of the crash.</S>
      <S SNO='6' PAR='6' RSNT='1'>Police officer Celerissimo De Simone said the pilot of the Piper aircraft had sent out a distress call at 5:50 p.m. just before the crash near Milan's main train station.</S>
      <S SNO='7' PAR='7' RSNT='1'>RAI state TV reported that the pilot said the SOS was because of engine trouble.</S>
      <S SNO='8' PAR='8' RSNT='1'>The plane had taken off from Locarno, Switzerland, and was heading to Milan's Linate airport, De Simone said.</S>
      <S SNO='9' PAR='9' RSNT='1'>Earlier, in Rome, the senate's president, Marcello Pera, said it "very probably" appeared to be a terrorist attack.</S>
      <S SNO='10' PAR='10' RSNT='1'>But Pera's spokesman later said he had spoken with the Interior Minister and the crash didn't appear to be any kind of an attack.</S>
      <S SNO='11' PAR='11' RSNT='1'>There were holes on both sides of the slim skyscraper.</S>
      <S SNO='12' PAR='12' RSNT='1'>"It sounded like a bomb.</S>
      <S SNO='13' PAR='13' RSNT='1'>The pavement shook like an earthquake," said a woman identifying herself only as Lucia.</S>
      <S SNO='14' PAR='14' RSNT='1'>"It was shocking," said Luccheta Antonio, 52, a barber down the block.</S>
      <S SNO='15' PAR='15' RSNT='1'>"The windows shook and the mirrors."</S>
      <S SNO='16' PAR='16' RSNT='1'>"It was a violent explosion," said Stefano Bottazzi, 35, who works in a skyscraper 500 yards from building.</S>
      <S SNO='17' PAR='17' RSNT='1'>"The clock fell to the floor."</S>
      <S SNO='18' PAR='18' RSNT='1'>On the streets, rescue workers in orange uniforms helped the injured   including a man with a bloody shirt holding his head.</S>
      <S SNO='19' PAR='19' RSNT='1'>Ambulances streamed into the area and pedestrians peered upward.</S>
      <S SNO='20' PAR='20' RSNT='1'>The crash put a hole in the 25th floor of the Pirelli building.</S>
      <S SNO='21' PAR='21' RSNT='1'>Police cordoned off the area as people gawked at the skyscraper.</S>
      <S SNO='22' PAR='22' RSNT='1'>At 30 stories high, the Pirelli skyscraper, located near the central train station, is Italy's first skyscraper and one of the world's tallest concrete buildings.</S>
      <S SNO='23' PAR='23' RSNT='1'>It was built in 1958 and designed by architects Gio Ponti and Pier Luigi Nervi.</S>
      <S SNO='24' PAR='24' RSNT='1'>The building is one of the main symbols of Milan, along with the city's cathedral.</S>
      <S SNO='25' PAR='25' RSNT='1'>White House press secretary Ari Fleischer said National Security Adviser Condoleezza Rice and White House chief of staff Andrew Card had informed Bush of the crash.</S>
      <S SNO='26' PAR='26' RSNT='1'>"The president just moments ago was informed about the incident in Milan," he said at his afternoon press briefing.</S>
      <S SNO='27' PAR='27' RSNT='1'>"I have no additional information at all for you at this time.</S>
      <S SNO='28' PAR='28' RSNT='1'>This is a breaking story and we don't have anything else beyond that   the president has been informed.</S>
      <S SNO='29' PAR='29' RSNT='1'>"I think you can presume that we will be   if we are not already   in touch with Italian authorities and will ascertain precisely what the facts are," Fleischer said.</S>
      <S SNO='30' PAR='30' RSNT='1'>In Washington, the FBI was trying to learn more about the incident.</S>
      <S SNO='31' PAR='31' RSNT='1'>One official said bureau personnel were assisting their Italian counterparts in the investigation.</S>
      <S SNO='32' PAR='32' RSNT='1'>It was the second time since the Sept. 11 terror attacks on New York and Washington that a plane has struck a high-rise building.</S>
      <S SNO='33' PAR='33' RSNT='1'>On Jan. 5, a 15-year-old boy crashed a stolen plane into a building in Tampa, Fla.</S>
      <S SNO='34' PAR='34' RSNT='1'>He was the only casualty.</S>
      <S SNO='35' PAR='35' RSNT='1'>The Associated Press contributed to this report.</S>
      <S SNO='36' PAR='36' RSNT='1'>Privacy Statement.</S>
      <S SNO='37' PAR='37' RSNT='1'>For FoxNews.com comments write to foxnewsonline foxnews.com comments foxnews.com http://www.foxsports.com/  Associated Press.</S>

      <S SNO='44' PAR='44' RSNT='1'>U.S.</S>
      <S SNO='45' PAR='45' RSNT='1'>Regional Maps / Forecasts   U.S.</S>
    </TEXT>
